Animation.name: animation
Animation.discription: A shorthand property for all the animation properties

Animation.name: animation-delay
Animation.discription: Specifies a delay for the start of an animation

Animation.name: animation-direction
Animation.discription: Specifies whether an animation should be played forwards, backwards or in alternate cycles

Animation.name: animation-duration
Animation.discription: Specifies how long an animation should take to complete one cycle

Animation.name: animation-fill-mode
Animation.discription: Specifies a style for the element when the animation is not playing (before it starts, after it ends, or both)

Animation.name: animation-iteration-count
Animation.discription: Specifies the number of times an animation should be played

Animation.name: animation-name
Animation.discription: Specifies a name for the @keyframes animation

Animation.name: animation-play-state
Animation.discription: Specifies whether the animation is running or paused

Animation.name: animation-timing-function
Animation.discription: Specifies the speed curve of an animation

Colors and Backgrounds.name: background
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: A shorthand property for setting all the background properties in one declaration

Colors and Backgrounds.name: border-image
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: A shorthand property for setting all the border-image-* properties

Colors and Backgrounds.name: border-radius
Colors and Backgrounds.discription:
A shorthand property for setting all the four border-*-radius properties. 
Setting 1 value will apply to all 4 corners, 
Setting 2 values will pair the opposite corners, 
Setting 3 will set the top-left, the top-right and bottom-left, and the bottom-right, 
Setting 4 values will apply the 4 radii clockwise starting from the top-left

Colors and Backgrounds.name: background-attachment
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Sets whether a background image scrolls with the rest of the page, or is fixed

Colors and Backgrounds.name: background-blend-mode
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Specifies the blending mode of each background layer (color/image)

Colors and Backgrounds.name: background-clip
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Defines how far the background (color or image) should extend within an element

Colors and Backgrounds.name: background-color
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Specifies the background color of an element

Colors and Backgrounds.name: background-image
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Specifies one or more background images for an element

Colors and Backgrounds.name: background-origin
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Specifies the origin position of a background image

Colors and Backgrounds.name: background-position
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Specifies the position of a background image

Colors and Backgrounds.name: background-repeat
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Sets if/how a background image will be repeated

Colors and Backgrounds.name: background-size
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Specifies the size of the background images

Colors and Backgrounds.name: border-bottom-left-radius
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Defines the radius of the border of the bottom-left corner

Colors and Backgrounds.name: border-bottom-right-radius
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Defines the radius of the border of the bottom-right corner

Colors and Backgrounds.name: border-image-outset
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Specifies the amount by which the border image area extends beyond the border box

Colors and Backgrounds.name: border-image-repeat
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Specifies whether the border image should be repeated, rounded or stretched

Colors and Backgrounds.name: border-image-slice
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Specifies how to slice the border image

Colors and Backgrounds.name: border-image-source
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Specifies the path to the image to be used as a border

Colors and Backgrounds.name: border-image-width
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Specifies the width of the border image

Colors and Backgrounds.name: border-top-left-radius
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Defines the radius of the border of the top-left corner

Colors and Backgrounds.name: border-top-right-radius
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Defines the radius of the border of the top-right corner

Colors and Backgrounds.name: box-shadow
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Attaches one or more shadows to an element

Colors and Backgrounds.name: caret-color
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Specifies the color of the cursor (caret) in inputs, textareas, or any element that is editable

Colors and Backgrounds.name: color
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Sets the color of text

Colors and Backgrounds.name: filter
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Defines effects (e.g. blurring or color shifting) on an element before the element is displayed

Colors and Backgrounds.name: opacity
Colors and Backgrounds.discription: Sets the opacity level for an element

Flex.name: flex
Flex.discription: Specifies the length of the item, relative to the rest

Flex.name: flex-flow
Flex.discription: A shorthand property for the flex-direction and the flex-wrap properties

Flex.name: flex-basis
Flex.discription: Specifies the initial length of a flexible item

Flex.name: flex-direction
Flex.discription: Specifies the direction of the flexible items

Flex.name: flex-grow
Flex.discription: Specifies how much the item will grow relative to the rest

Flex.name: flex-shrink
Flex.discription: Specifies how the item will shrink relative to the rest

Flex.name: flex-wrap
Flex.discription: Specifies whether the flexible items should wrap or not

Flex.name: order
Flex.discription: Sets the order of the flexible item, relative to the rest

Generated Content and Lists.name: list-style
Generated Content and Lists.discription: Sets all the properties for a list in one declaration

Generated Content and Lists.name: content
Generated Content and Lists.discription: Used with the :before and :after pseudo-elements, to insert generated content

Generated Content and Lists.name: counter-increment
Generated Content and Lists.discription: Increases or decreases the value of one or more CSS counters

Generated Content and Lists.name: counter-reset
Generated Content and Lists.discription: Creates or resets one or more CSS counters

Generated Content and Lists.name: list-style-image
Generated Content and Lists.discription: Specifies an image as the list-item marker

Generated Content and Lists.name: list-style-position
Generated Content and Lists.discription: Specifies if the list-item markers should appear inside or outside the content flow

Generated Content and Lists.name: list-style-type
Generated Content and Lists.discription: Specifies the type of list-item marker

Generated Content and Lists.name: quotes
Generated Content and Lists.discription: Sets the type of quotation marks for embedded quotations

Grid.name: column-rule
Grid.discription: A shorthand property for setting all the column-rule-* properties

Grid.name: columns
Grid.discription: A shorthand property for setting column-width and column-count

Grid.name: grid
Grid.discription: A shorthand property

Grid.name: grid-area
Grid.discription: Either specifies a name for the grid item, or this property is a shorthand property for the grid-row-start, grid-column-start, grid-row-end, and grid-column-end properties

Grid.name: grid-column
Grid.discription: A shorthand property for the grid-column-start and the grid-column-end properties

Grid.name: grid-gap
Grid.discription: A shorthand property for the grid-row-gap and grid-column-gap properties

Grid.name: grid-row
Grid.discription: A shorthand property for the grid-row-start and the grid-row-end properties

Grid.name: grid-template
Grid.discription: A shorthand property for the grid-template-rows, grid-template-columns and grid-areas properties

Grid.name: break-after
Grid.discription: Specifies the page-, column-, or region-break behavior after the generated box

Grid.name: break-before
Grid.discription: Specifies the page-, column-, or region-break behavior before the generated box

Grid.name: break-inside
Grid.discription: Specifies the page-, column-, or region-break behavior inside the generated box

Grid.name: column-count
Grid.discription: Specifies the number of columns an element should be divided into

Grid.name: column-fill
Grid.discription: Specifies how to fill columns, balanced or not

Grid.name: column-gap
Grid.discription: Specifies the gap between the columns

Grid.name: column-rule-color
Grid.discription: Specifies the color of the rule between columns

Grid.name: column-rule-style
Grid.discription: Specifies the style of the rule between columns

Grid.name: column-rule-width
Grid.discription: Specifies the width of the rule between columns

Grid.name: column-span
Grid.discription: Specifies how many columns an element should span across

Grid.name: column-width
Grid.discription: Specifies the column width

Grid.name: grid-auto-columns
Grid.discription: Specifies a default column size

Grid.name: grid-auto-flow
Grid.discription: Specifies how auto-placed items are inserted in the grid

Grid.name: grid-auto-rows
Grid.discription: Specifies a default row size

Grid.name: grid-column-end
Grid.discription: Specifies where to end the grid item

Grid.name: grid-column-gap
Grid.discription: Specifies the size of the gap between columns

Grid.name: grid-column-start
Grid.discription: Specifies where to start the grid item

Grid.name: grid-row-end
Grid.discription: Specifies where to end the grid item

Grid.name: grid-row-gap
Grid.discription: Specifies the size of the gap between rows

Grid.name: grid-row-start
Grid.discription: Specifies where to start the grid item

Grid.name: grid-template-areas
Grid.discription: Specifies how to display columns and rows, using named grid items

Grid.name: grid-template-columns
Grid.discription: Specifies the size of the columns, and how many columns in a grid layout

Grid.name: grid-template-rows
Grid.discription: Specifies the size of the rows in a grid layout

Misc..name: outline
Misc..discription: Sets all the outline properties in one declaration

Misc..name: @charset
Misc..discription: Specifies the character encoding used in the style sheet

Misc..name: all
Misc..discription: Resets all properties (excepct unicode-bidi and direction)

Misc..name: cursor
Misc..discription: Specifies the mouse cursor to be displayed when pointing over an element

Misc..name: pointer-events
Misc..discription: The pointer-events property defines whether or not an element reacts to pointer events.

Misc..name: outline-color
Misc..discription: Sets the color of an outline

Misc..name: outline-style
Misc..discription: Sets the style of an outline

Misc..name: outline-width
Misc..discription: Sets the width of an outline

Misc..name: unicode-bidi
Misc..discription: Used together with the direction property to set or return whether the text should be overridden to support multiple languages in the same document

3D.name: perspective
3D.discription: Specifies the perspective on how 3D elements are viewed

3D.name: perspective-origin
3D.discription: Specifies the position that the user is looking at the element

3D.name: transform-style
3D.discription: Specifies how nested elements are rendered in 3D space

Text and Fonts.name: font
Text and Fonts.discription: Sets all the font properties in one declaration

Text and Fonts.name: @font-face
Text and Fonts.discription: A rule that allows websites to download and use fonts other than the "web-safe" fonts

Text and Fonts.name: font-family
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the font family for text

Text and Fonts.name: font-feature-settings
Text and Fonts.discription: Allows control over advanced typographic features in OpenType fonts

Text and Fonts.name: font-kerning
Text and Fonts.discription: Controls the usage of the kerning information (how letters are spaced)

Text and Fonts.name: font-size
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the font size of text

Text and Fonts.name: font-size-adjust
Text and Fonts.discription: Preserves the readability of text when font fallback occurs

Text and Fonts.name: font-stretch
Text and Fonts.discription: Selects a normal, condensed, or expanded face from a font family

Text and Fonts.name: font-style
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the font style for text

Text and Fonts.name: font-variant
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies whether or not a text should be displayed in a small-caps font

Text and Fonts.name: font-variant-caps
Text and Fonts.discription: Controls the usage of alternate glyphs for capital letters

Text and Fonts.name: font-variant-east-asian
Text and Fonts.discription: Controls the usage of alternate glyphs for East Asian scripts (e.g Japanese and Chinese)

Text and Fonts.name: font-variant-ligatures
Text and Fonts.discription: Controls which ligatures and contextual forms are used in textual content of the elements it applies to

Text and Fonts.name: font-variant-numeric
Text and Fonts.discription: Controls the usage of alternate glyphs for numbers, fractions, and ordinal markers

Text and Fonts.name: font-variant-position
Text and Fonts.discription: Controls the usage of alternate glyphs of smaller size positioned as superscript or subscript regarding the baseline of the font

Text and Fonts.name: font-weight
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the weight of a font

Text and Fonts.name: hanging-punctuation
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies whether a punctuation character may be placed outside the line box

Text and Fonts.name: hyphens
Text and Fonts.discription: Sets how to split words to improve the layout of paragraphs

Text and Fonts.name: letter-spacing
Text and Fonts.discription: Increases or decreases the space between characters in a text

Text and Fonts.name: line-break
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies how/if to break lines

Text and Fonts.name: line-height
Text and Fonts.discription: Sets the line height

Text and Fonts.name: text-align
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the horizontal alignment of text

Text and Fonts.name: text-decoration
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the decoration added to text

Text and Fonts.name: text-indent
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the indentation of the first line in a text-block

Text and Fonts.name: text-transform
Text and Fonts.discription: Controls the capitalization of text

Text and Fonts.name: user-select
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies whether the text of an element can be selected

Text and Fonts.name: vertical-align
Text and Fonts.discription: Sets the vertical alignment of an element

Text and Fonts.name: white-space
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies how white-space inside an element is handled

Text and Fonts.name: word-break
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies line breaking rules for non-CJK scripts

Text and Fonts.name: word-spacing
Text and Fonts.discription: Increases or decreases the space between words in a text

Text and Fonts.name: word-wrap
Text and Fonts.discription: Allows long, unbreakable words to be broken and wrap to the next line

Text and Fonts.name: tab-size
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the length of the tab-character

Text and Fonts.name: text-align-last
Text and Fonts.discription: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when text-align is "justify"

Text and Fonts.name: text-combine-upright
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the combination of multiple characters into the space of a single character

Text and Fonts.name: text-decoration-color
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the color of the text-decoration

Text and Fonts.name: text-decoration-line
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the type of line in a text-decoration

Text and Fonts.name: text-decoration-style
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the style of the line in a text decoration

Text and Fonts.name: text-justify
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the justification method used when text-align is "justify"

Text and Fonts.name: text-orientation
Text and Fonts.discription: Defines the orientation of the text in a line

Text and Fonts.name: text-overflow
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies what should happen when text overflows the containing element

Text and Fonts.name: text-shadow
Text and Fonts.discription: Adds shadow to text

Text and Fonts.name: text-underline-position
Text and Fonts.discription: Specifies the position of the underline which is set using the text-decoration property

The Box Model.name: border
The Box Model.discription: A shorthand property for border-width, border-style and border-color

The Box Model.name: border-bottom
The Box Model.discription: A shorthand property for setting all the bottom border properties in one declaration

The Box Model.name: border-left
The Box Model.discription: A shorthand property for setting all the left border properties in one declaration

The Box Model.name: border-right
The Box Model.discription: A shorthand property for setting all the right border properties in one declaration

The Box Model.name: border-top
The Box Model.discription: A shorthand property for setting all the top border properties in one declaration

The Box Model.name: margin
The Box Model.discription: Sets all the margin properties in one declaration

The Box Model.name: padding
The Box Model.discription: Sets all the padding properties in one declaration

The Box Model.name: border-bottom-color
The Box Model.discription: Sets the color of the bottom border

The Box Model.name: border-bottom-style
The Box Model.discription: Sets the style of the bottom border

The Box Model.name: border-bottom-width
The Box Model.discription: Sets the width of the bottom border

The Box Model.name: border-color
The Box Model.discription: Sets the color of the four borders

The Box Model.name: border-left-color
The Box Model.discription: Sets the color of the left border

The Box Model.name: border-left-style
The Box Model.discription: Sets the style of the left border

The Box Model.name: border-left-width
The Box Model.discription: Sets the width of the left border

The Box Model.name: border-right-color
The Box Model.discription: Sets the color of the right border

The Box Model.name: border-right-style
The Box Model.discription: Sets the style of the right border

The Box Model.name: border-right-width
The Box Model.discription: Sets the width of the right border

The Box Model.name: border-style
The Box Model.discription: Sets the style of the four borders

The Box Model.name: border-top-color
The Box Model.discription: Sets the color of the top border

The Box Model.name: border-top-style
The Box Model.discription: Sets the style of the top border

The Box Model.name: border-top-width
The Box Model.discription: Sets the width of the top border

The Box Model.name: border-width
The Box Model.discription: Sets the width of the four borders

The Box Model.name: box-decoration-break
The Box Model.discription: Sets the behavior of the background and border of an element at page-break, or, for in-line elements, at line-break.

The Box Model.name: box-sizing
The Box Model.discription: Defines how the width and height of an element are calculated: should they include padding and borders, or not

The Box Model.name: margin-bottom
The Box Model.discription: Sets the bottom margin of an element

The Box Model.name: margin-left
The Box Model.discription: Sets the left margin of an element

The Box Model.name: margin-right
The Box Model.discription: Sets the right margin of an element

The Box Model.name: margin-top
The Box Model.discription: Sets the top margin of an element

The Box Model.name: outline-offset
The Box Model.discription: Offsets an outline, and draws it beyond the border edge

The Box Model.name: padding-bottom
The Box Model.discription: Sets the bottom padding of an element

The Box Model.name: padding-left
The Box Model.discription: Sets the left padding of an element

The Box Model.name: padding-right
The Box Model.discription: Sets the right padding of an element

The Box Model.name: padding-top
The Box Model.discription: Sets the top padding of an element

Transitions.name: transition
Transitions.discription: A shorthand property for setting the four transition properties

Transitions.name: transition-delay
Transitions.discription: Specifies when the transition effect will start

Transitions.name: transition-duration
Transitions.discription: Specifies how many seconds or milliseconds a transition effect takes to complete

Transitions.name: transition-property
Transitions.discription: Specifies the name of the CSS property the transition effect is for

Transitions.name: transition-timing-function
Transitions.discription: Specifies the speed curve of the transition effect

Paged Media.name: @media
Paged Media.discription: Sets the style rules for different media types/devices/sizes

Paged Media.name: orphans
Paged Media.discription: Sets the minimum number of lines that must be left at the bottom of a page when a page break occurs inside an element

Paged Media.name: page-break-after
Paged Media.discription: Sets the page-breaking behavior after an element

Paged Media.name: page-break-before
Paged Media.discription: Sets the page-breaking behavior before an element

Paged Media.name: page-break-inside
Paged Media.discription: Sets the page-breaking behavior inside an element

Paged Media.name: widows
Paged Media.discription: Sets the minimum number of lines that must be left at the top of a page when a page break occurs inside an element

Pseudo Element.name: ::after
Pseudo Element.discription: The ::after creates a pseudo-element that is the last child of the selected element. It is often used to add cosmetic content to an element with the content property. It is inline by default.

Pseudo Element.name: ::backdrop
Pseudo Element.discription: The ::backdrop CSS pseudo-element is a box rendered immediately below any element rendered in fullscreen mode (and above any lower elements in the stack).

Pseudo Element.name: ::before
Pseudo Element.discription: The ::before creates a pseudo-element that is the first child of the selected element. It is often used to add cosmetic content to an element with the content property. It is inline by default.

Pseudo Element.name: ::cue
Pseudo Element.discription: The ::cue CSS pseudo-element matches WebVTT cues within a selected element. This can be used to style captions and other cues in media with VTT tracks.

Pseudo Element.name: ::first-letter
Pseudo Element.discription: The ::first-letter CSS pseudo-element applies styles to the first letter of the first line of a block-level element, but only when not preceded by other content (such as images or inline tables).

Pseudo Element.name: ::first-line
Pseudo Element.discription: The ::first-line CSS pseudo-element applies styles to the first line of a block-level element. Note that the length of the first line depends on many factors, including the width of the element, the width of the document, and the font size of the text.

Pseudo Element.name: ::grammar-error
Pseudo Element.discription: The ::grammar-error CSS pseudo-element represents a text segment which the user agent has flagged as grammatically incorrect.

Pseudo Element.name: ::marker
Pseudo Element.discription: The ::marker CSS pseudo-element selects the marker box of a list item, which typically contains a bullet or number. It works on any element or pseudo-element set to display: list-item, such as the <li> and <summary> elements.

Pseudo Element.name: ::placeholder
Pseudo Element.discription: The ::placeholder CSS pseudo-element represents the placeholder text of a formelement.

Pseudo Element.name: ::selection
Pseudo Element.discription: The ::selection CSS pseudo-element applies styles to the portion of a document that has been highlighted by the user (such as with the mouse).

Pseudo Element.name: ::spelling-error
Pseudo Element.discription: The ::spelling-error CSS pseudo-element represents a text segment which the user agent has flagged as incorrectly spelled.

Pseudo Class.name: :active
Pseudo Class.discription: The :active CSS pseudo-class represents an element (such as a button) that is being activated by the user. When using a mouse, "activation" typically starts when the user presses down the primary mouse button and ends when it is released. The :active pseudo-class is commonly used on <a> and <button> elements, but may be used on other elements, too.

Pseudo Class.name: :any
Pseudo Class.discription: The :any() pseudo-class lets you create a selector containing multiple options, any one of which will be matched. This is a simpler alternative to repeating an entire selector multiple times because one item inside it varies.

Pseudo Class.name: :any-link
Pseudo Class.discription: The :any-link CSS pseudo-class selector represents an element that acts as the source anchor of a hyperlink, independent of whether it has been visited. In other words, it matches every <a>, <area>, or <link> element that has an href attribute. Thus, it matches all elements that match :link or :visited.

Pseudo Class.name: :checked
Pseudo Class.discription: The :checked CSS pseudo-class selector represents any radio (<input type="radio">), checkbox (<input type="checkbox">), or option (<option> in a <select>) element that is checked or toggled to an on state.

Pseudo Class.name: :default
Pseudo Class.discription: The :default CSS pseudo-class represents any form element that is the default among a group of related elements. Grouped elements that permit multiple selections may also have multiple defaults, i.e., they may have multiple items initially selected. In this case, all defaults are represented using the :default pseudo-class. For example, you can style the default checkboxes among a group of checkboxes.

Pseudo Class.name: :dir()
Pseudo Class.discription: The :dir() CSS pseudo-class matches elements based on the directionality of the text contained in them. The :dir() pseudo-class uses only the semantic value of the directionality, i.e., the one defined in the document itself. It doesn't account for styling directionality, i.e., the directionality set by CSS properties such as direction.

Pseudo Class.name: :disabled
Pseudo Class.discription: The :disabled CSS pseudo-class represents any disabled element. An element is disabled if it can't be activated (selected, clicked on, typed into, etc.) or accept focus. The element also has an enabled state, in which it can be activated or accept focus.

Pseudo Class.name: :empty
Pseudo Class.discription: The :empty CSS pseudo-class represents any element that has no children. Children can be either element nodes or text (including whitespace). Comments or processing instructions do not affect whether an element is considered empty or not.

Pseudo Class.name: :enabled
Pseudo Class.discription: The :enabled CSS pseudo-class represents any enabled element. An element is enabled if it can be activated (selected, clicked on, typed into, etc.) or accept focus. The element also has a disabled state, in which it can't be activated or accept focus.

Pseudo Class.name: :first
Pseudo Class.discription: The :first CSS pseudo-class, used with the  @page at-rule, represents the first page of a printed document.

Pseudo Class.name: :first-child
Pseudo Class.discription: The :first-child CSS pseudo-class represents the first element among a group of sibling elements.

Pseudo Class.name: :first-of-type
Pseudo Class.discription: The :first-of-type CSS pseudo-class represents the first element of its type among a group of sibling elements.

Pseudo Class.name: :fullscreen
Pseudo Class.discription: The :fullscreen CSS pseudo-class represents an element that's displayed when the browser is in fullscreen mode.

Pseudo Class.name: :focus
Pseudo Class.discription: The :focus CSS pseudo-class represents an element (such as a form input) that has received focus. It is generally triggered when the user clicks or taps on an element or selects it with the keyboard's "tab" key.

Pseudo Class.name: :hover
Pseudo Class.discription: The :hover CSS pseudo-class matches when the user interacts with an element with a pointing device, but does not necessarily activate it. It is generally triggered when the user hovers over an element with the cursor (mouse pointer).

Pseudo Class.name: :indeterminate
Pseudo Class.discription: The :indeterminate CSS pseudo-class represents any form element whose state is indeterminate.

Pseudo Class.name: :in-range
Pseudo Class.discription: The :in-range CSS pseudo-class represents an <input> element whose current value is within the range limits specified by the min and max attributes.

Pseudo Class.name: :invalid
Pseudo Class.discription: The :invalid CSS pseudo-class represents any <input> or other <form> element whose contents fail to validate.

Pseudo Class.name: :lang()
Pseudo Class.discription: The :lang() CSS pseudo-class matches elements based on the language they are determined to be in.

Pseudo Class.name: :last-child
Pseudo Class.discription: The :last-child CSS pseudo-class represents the last element among a group of sibling elements. It is also an Aerosmith hit.

Pseudo Class.name: :last-of-type
Pseudo Class.discription: The :last-of-type CSS pseudo-class represents the last element of its type among a group of sibling elements.

Pseudo Class.name: :left
Pseudo Class.discription: The :left CSS pseudo-class, used with the  @page at-rule, represents all left-hand pages of a printed document.

Pseudo Class.name: :link
Pseudo Class.discription: The :link CSS pseudo-class represents an element that has not yet been visited. It matches every unvisited <a>, <area>, or <link> element that has an href attribute.

Pseudo Class.name: :not()
Pseudo Class.discription: The :not() CSS pseudo-class represents elements that do not match a list of selectors. Since it prevents specific items from being selected, it is known as the negation pseudo-class.

Pseudo Class.name: :nth-child()
Pseudo Class.discription: The :nth-child() CSS pseudo-class matches one or more elements based on their position among a group of siblings. Takes a interger. Append a 'n' for repetitive.

Pseudo Class.name: :nth-last-child()
Pseudo Class.discription: The :nth-last-child() CSS pseudo-class matches one or more elements based on their position among a group of siblings, counting from the end.

Pseudo Class.name: :nth-last-of-type()
Pseudo Class.discription: The :nth-last-of-type() CSS pseudo-class matches one or more elements of a given type, based on their position among a group of siblings, counting from the end.

Pseudo Class.name: :nth-of-type()
Pseudo Class.discription: The :nth-of-type() CSS pseudo-class matches one or more elements of a given type, based on their position among a group of siblings.

Pseudo Class.name: :only-child
Pseudo Class.discription: The :only-child CSS pseudo-class represents an element without any siblings. This is the same as :first-child:last-child or :nth-child(1):nth-last-child(1), but with a lower specificity.

Pseudo Class.name: :only-of-type
Pseudo Class.discription: The :only-of-type CSS pseudo-class represents an element that has no siblings of the same type.

Pseudo Class.name: :optional
Pseudo Class.discription: The :optional CSS pseudo-class represents any <input>, <select>, or <textarea>element that does not have the required attribute set on it.

Pseudo Class.name: :out-of-range
Pseudo Class.discription: The :out-of-range CSS pseudo-class represents an <input> element whose current value is outside the range limits specified by the min and max attributes.

Pseudo Class.name: :read-only
Pseudo Class.discription: The :read-only CSS pseudo-class represents an element (such as a locked text input) that is not editable by the user.

Pseudo Class.name: :read-write
Pseudo Class.discription: The :read-write CSS pseudo-class represents an element (such as a text input) that is editable by the user.

Pseudo Class.name: :required
Pseudo Class.discription: The :required CSS pseudo-class represents any <input>, <select>, or <textarea> element that has the required attribute set on it.

Pseudo Class.name: :right
Pseudo Class.discription: The :right CSS pseudo-class, used with the  @page at-rule, represents all right-hand pages of a printed document.

Pseudo Class.name: :root
Pseudo Class.discription: The :root CSS pseudo-class matches the root element of a tree representing the document. In HTML, :root represents the <html> element and is identical to the selector html, except that its specificity is higher.

Pseudo Class.name: :scope
Pseudo Class.discription: The :scope CSS pseudo-class represents elements that are a reference point for selectors to match against.

Pseudo Class.name: :target
Pseudo Class.discription: The :target CSS pseudo-class represents a unique element (the target element) with an id matching the URL's fragment.

Pseudo Class.name: :valid
Pseudo Class.discription: The :valid CSS pseudo-class represents any <input> or other <form> element whose contents validate successfully. This allows to easily make valid fields adopt an appearance that helps the user confirm that their data is formatted properly.

Pseudo Class.name: :visited
Pseudo Class.discription: The :visited CSS pseudo-class represents links that the user has already visited. For privacy reasons, the styles that can be modified using this selector are very limited.

Tables.name: border-collapse
Tables.discription: Sets whether table borders should collapse into a single border or be separated

Tables.name: border-spacing
Tables.discription: Sets the distance between the borders of adjacent cells

Tables.name: caption-side
Tables.discription: Specifies the placement of a table caption

Tables.name: empty-cells
Tables.discription: Specifies whether or not to display borders and background on empty cells in a table

Tables.name: table-layout
Tables.discription: Sets the layout algorithm to be used for a table

Transformations.name: transform
Transformations.discription: Applies a 2D or 3D transformation to an element

Transformations.name: transform-origin
Transformations.discription: Allows you to change the position on transformed elements

Transformations.name: touch-action
Transformations.discription: Sets how an element's region can be manipulated by a touchscreen user (for example, by zooming features built into the browser)

Visual Formatting.name: align-content
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies the alignment between the lines inside a flexible container when the items do not use all available space

Visual Formatting.name: align-items
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies the alignment for items inside a flexible container

Visual Formatting.name: align-self
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies the alignment for selected items inside a flexible container

Visual Formatting.name: backface-visibility
Visual Formatting.discription: Defines whether or not the back face of an element should be visible when facing the user

Visual Formatting.name: bottom
Visual Formatting.discription: Sets the elements position, from the bottom of its parent element

Visual Formatting.name: clear
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies on which sides of an element floating elements are not allowed to float

Visual Formatting.name: clip-path
Visual Formatting.discription: Clips an absolutely positioned element

Visual Formatting.name: display
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies how a certain HTML element should be displayed

Visual Formatting.name: float
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies whether or not a box should float

Visual Formatting.name: height
Visual Formatting.discription: Sets the height of an element

Visual Formatting.name: image-orientation
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies a rotation in the right or clockwise direction that a user agent applies to an image (This property is likely going to be deprecated and its functionality moved to HTML)

Visual Formatting.name: image-rendering
Visual Formatting.discription: Gives a hint to the browser about what aspects of an image are most important to preserve when the image is scaled

Visual Formatting.name: justify-content
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies the alignment between the items inside a flexible container when the items do not use all available space

Visual Formatting.name: left
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies the left position of a positioned element

Visual Formatting.name: max-height
Visual Formatting.discription: Sets the maximum height of an element

Visual Formatting.name: max-width
Visual Formatting.discription: Sets the maximum width of an element

Visual Formatting.name: min-height
Visual Formatting.discription: Sets the minimum height of an element

Visual Formatting.name: min-width
Visual Formatting.discription: Sets the minimum width of an element

Visual Formatting.name: object-fit
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies how the contents of a replaced element should be fitted to the box established by its used height and width

Visual Formatting.name: object-position
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies the alignment of the replaced element inside its box

Visual Formatting.name: overflow
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies what happens if content overflows an element's box

Visual Formatting.name: overflow-wrap
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies whether or not the browser may break lines within words in order to prevent overflow (when a string is too long to fit its containing box)

Visual Formatting.name: overflow-x
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies whether or not to clip the left/right edges of the content, if it overflows the element's content area

Visual Formatting.name: overflow-y
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies whether or not to clip the top/bottom edges of the content, if it overflows the element's content area

Visual Formatting.name: position
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies the type of positioning method used for an element (static, relative, absolute or fixed)

Visual Formatting.name: resize
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies whether or not an element is resizable by the user

Visual Formatting.name: right
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies the right position of a positioned element

Visual Formatting.name: top
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies the top position of a positioned element

Visual Formatting.name: visibility
Visual Formatting.discription: Specifies whether or not an element is visible

Visual Formatting.name: width
Visual Formatting.discription: Sets the width of an element

Visual Formatting.name: z-index
Visual Formatting.discription: Sets the stack order of a positioned element

At Selectors.name: @charset
At Selectors.discription: Specifies the character encoding used in the style sheet

At Selectors.name: @font-face
At Selectors.discription: A rule that allows websites to download and use fonts other than the "web-safe" fonts

At Selectors.name: @media
At Selectors.discription: Sets the style rules for different media types/devices/sizes
